intro: Cephalomappa beccariana var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved cephalomappa, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as understorey habitats in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
